description: works well, even on mobile linux (postmarketOS). but no touch input that I could find.

I just came from using M64p. M64p seems like there's a bit of a learning curve to tweak the graphics. Rosalie's Mupen was much easier to pick up.

Highly recommended!

Customizable up the wazooo
Games look amazing, wow childhood memories
Dev is great

Coming from Project64, this was really easy to set up. Everything is exactly how it used to be, albeit a few missing features currently. So far I only have a couple of nitpicks:

- Some game saves are shared if they aren't the original ROM (i.g. rom hacks), it would be nice to have save files based on the file name instead of the game
- Adding custom cheats is a little funky, I was hoping that I could just transfer mine from PJ64 but I couldn't find the directory, if even possible
Ideal Linux counterpart to Project64. GlideN64 video plugin even comes pre-installed for access to advanced video settings.
solid emu,best on steam os
Resident Evil 2 doesn't work.

This had one advantage, cheats, but the emu folder navigation needs work.

Some reason it wont detect my sd card directory thats pinned to my quick accses bar, everything else other than this emulator can access it.

so i copy my roms to my pictures directory on my internal drive and still, no rom folder.

so i copy to the actual emulator flatpak installation directory and still nothing.

i then copy and place my roms (.n64/.z64) into the same directories, and still nothing.

This emulator needs to be capable of having better accsess to view directories and sub directories.

There seems to be no support whatsoever to change controls for steam deck users. changes made in the application will save and register cleanly but upon booting any game in desktop mode or game mode all controls completely disable and no inputs will register. Even troubleshooting in the discord there does not seem to be a fix. This is a glaring issue that steers me away from this application.

This is a thorough and very well-made frontend! I've tried several other Mupen64 frontends, and all of them were okay to meh, and lacked fine-tuning and quality-of-life features this one has. The level of customization and robustness of features is refreshing! Frankly, nothing else compares. Thank you for making and sharing this! H8Rs can STFU.
Works properly.
